intro: Habranthus catamarcensis, commonly known as the Catamarcensis grass of heaven, is a flowering plant native to Argentina. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and is known for its ornamental value. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of bell-shaped flowers. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
